"!")                                                                   | [@](/wiki/@ "@")                                                                   | [#](/wiki/Hash_mark "Hash mark")                                                   | [$](/wiki/$ "$")                                                                   | [%](/wiki/%25 "%")                                                                 | [^](/wiki/%5E "^") | [&](/wiki/%26 "&") | [\*](/wiki/* "*") | [(](/wiki/\( "(")    | [)](/wiki/\) ")")        | [\_](/wiki/Underscore "Underscore")      | [+](/wiki/Plus_sign "Plus sign")         |              [space](/wiki/Space "Space")             |                                                         |                         |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
| [\`](/wiki/%60 "`")                               | [1](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [2](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [3](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [4](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [5](/wiki/Numbers_used_in_the_warning_system "Numbers used in the warning system") | [6](/wiki/6 "6")   | [7](/wiki/7 "7")   | [8](/wiki/8 "8")  | [9](/wiki/9 "9")     | [0](/wiki/0 "0")         | [-](/wiki/- "-")                         | [=](/wiki/%3D "=")                       |   [{](/wiki/Left_curly_bracket "Left curly bracket")  | [}](/wiki/Right_curly_bracket "Right curly bracket")    | [\|](/wiki/Pipe "Pipe") |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |

|                                                   | [Aa](/wiki/A "A")                                                                  | [Ss](/wiki/S "S")                                                                  | [Dd](/wiki/D "D")                                                                  | [Ff](/wiki/F "F")                                                                  | [Gg](/wiki/G "G")                                                                  | [Hh](/wiki/H "H")  | [Jj](/wiki/J "J")  | [Kk](/wiki/K "K") | [Ll](/wiki/L "L")    | [?](/wiki/%3F "?")       | [;](/wiki/; ";")                         | ['](/wiki/%27 "'")                       |               [Ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl")               |                                                         |                         |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |
|                                                   | [Zz](/wiki/Z "Z")                                                                  | [Xx](/wiki/X "X")                                                                  | [Cc](/wiki/C "C")                                                                  | [Vv](/wiki/V "V")                                                                  | [Bb](/wiki/B "B")                                                                  | [Nn](/wiki/N "N")  | [Mm](/wiki/M "M")  | [,](/wiki/, ",")  | [.](/wiki/Dot "Dot") | [/](/wiki/Slash "Slash") | [<](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket") | [>](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket") |                 [Alt](/wiki/Alt "Alt")                |                                                         |                         |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |   |

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **backslash** (**\\**) serves the following purposes:

- \ character represents a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne").
- \ is used for drawing diagonal [rays](/wiki/Ray "Ray").

* Press [\\](/wiki/%5C "\\") to view your current knowledge about [identified items](/wiki/Discoveries "Discoveries").
* In [a menu](/wiki/Menu_controls "Menu controls"), pressing [\\](/wiki/%5C "\\") deselects all items on the current page.
* A French-Canadian keyboard layout will prevent the backslash command from working, due to requiring a tricky manipulation that is not processed properly in most Windows terminals - you may need to change your keyboard layout to a US layout and restart *NetHack*, or else play the game via a Linux tty (which handles the French-Canadian layout correctly) or a graphical port.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Backslash

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Not to be confused with slash.
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the backslash (\) serves the following purposes:

  • \ character represents a throne.
  • \ is used for drawing diagonal rays.
  • Press \ to view your current knowledge about identified items.
  • In a menu, pressing \ deselects all items on the current page.
  • A French-Canadian keyboard layout will prevent the backslash command from working, due to requiring a tricky manipulation that is not processed properly in most Windows terminals - you may need to change your keyboard layout to a US layout and restart NetHack, or else play the game via a Linux tty (which handles the French-Canadian layout correctly) or a graphical port.
